thread.title: Insider Reveals Trump’s Transition Team Was Under Surveillance After Election Day
thread.title_full: Insider Reveals Trump’s Transition Team Was Under Surveillance After Election Day

author: Charles Campbell
title: Insider Reveals Trump’s Transition Team Was Under Surveillance After Election Day
text:
News Site Suspends Three Staffers Over Report Implying Obama Conspiracy 
There were, he said, “dozens of reports, but no mention of Russia.” 
Nunes said information collected on Trump’s team was part of a routine investigation. However, the information leaked and spread throughout the intelligence community. . @DevinNunes : Information was “incidentally collected” about people involved in Trump transition; surveillance not related to Russia probe. pic.twitter.com/dBGZ8dSGjJ 
— ABC News Politics (@ABCPolitics) March 22, 2017 
Nunes previously denied allegations that the Obama administration had wiretapped Trump Tower. Advertisement - story continues below 
“Let me be clear, I’ve been saying this for several weeks, we know there was not a physical wiretap of Trump Tower. However, it’s still possible that other surveillance activities were used against President Trump and his associates,” Nunes said during Monday’s hearing on Russia’s meddling in the U.S. election. 
However, he told reporters he wouldn’t be ruling anything out until his team had adequately reviewed all the information possible 
“Until we get all the names that were unmasked and we look at all the intelligence products that had American names in it, we won’t know until we get to see that,” Nunes said. 
Trump and his allies have largely been focused on finding people within the government who leaked the information. Advertisement - story continues below
